Argentina: Santa María del Buen Ayre founded by Pedro de Mendoza on site of modern Buenos Aires
Barbados: Portuguese explorer Pedro Campos or Pedro Campas, is said to have landed on Barbados and also found it uninhabited.
Chile: Almagro's expedition crosses the Andes into the Copiapó River valley and explores the central region of Chile as far south as the Aconcagua River valley.

Almagro sends an expedition under :es:Gómez de Alvarado southwards toward the Bio-Bio region. The expedition ends in the Battle of Reynogüelén, considered to be the first battle of the Arauco War, with native Mapuches near the Itata River.
Colombia: The strenuous Spanish conquest expedition starts from Santa Marta
Sebastián de Belalcázar founded the village of Santiago de Cali
England: William Tyndale was executed in Antwerp.
Henry VIII issued the Dissolution of the Monasteries.
Philippine: The Loaysa expedition returns to Spain. One of its survivors is Andres de Urdaneta, its chronicler.
